Ubuntu Fiesty Fawn locked up after daughter was scrolling through screen saver selection
I had to reboot and the computer rebooted to root@computername: #
On start-up it said their were problems with corrupted files
I ran fsck -y and then it booted back to gnome
but I really have no idea what I'm doing
Is there a Ubuntu program to check if my harddisk is bad?
most likely a configuration file was damaged, fsck moved it to lost+found and it was recreated at next GNOME start
look into your AGP settings e.g. Fast Write and speed
you can explicity set them in /etc/X11/xorg.conf. the manpage for xorg.conf and your video driver will help
disabling AGP fast write and setting speed to 4x might help. try each in turn
you got it
Applications|Accessories|Terminal and sudo
from X, Ctrl-Alt-F1 and log in
your GNOME session
good. logout and Alt-F7 to get back to GNOME
if Ctrl-Alt-Del won't reboot your system, it's a reset/power off i'm afraid
what filesystem are you using?
no, the underlying filesystem. Ext3 or something else?
then it's probably Ext3 but it should handle lock-ups reasonably well
